text: Storage: Are learned_*.jsonl files stored locally (~/.stillwater/), in Google Cloud Storage (GCS), or both (local + sync to GCS)?
Multi-user solaceagi.com: Should each user have their own learned_*.jsonl (user-specific learning) or shared database (collective learning)?
Collective learning: If shared, how do we prevent one user's bad override from polluting another user's CPU? (confidence filtering insufficient?)
Local installs: Should CLI users (stillwater/cli OSS) get their own learned_*.jsonl in ~/.stillwater/orchestration/? How does it sync with solaceagi.com?
Visibility: Should users be able to see/edit their learned_*.jsonl? Via CLI command? Via solaceagi.com dashboard? Read-only audit log?
Config visibility: Should learned entries show HOW they were learned (which LLM validator, which date, which context)? For audit/transparency?
Prime Mermaid: Should we diagram the CPU-LLM feedback loop as a state machine? Would help users understand the flow visually?
Google Platform specifics: Should learned_*.jsonl be stored in Firestore (real-time sync), Cloud Storage (batch sync), or Datastore (legacy)?
Sync conflict: If user runs local CLI offline, then cloud validator adds learning, how do we merge without conflict when user comes back online?
Rollback/deletion: Should users be able to DELETE a learned entry if it's causing bad behavior? Or just disable it?
Versioning: Should learned_*.jsonl have schema versioning? What if we add new fields in future (e.g., 'user_feedback_rating')?
Privacy: Should solaceagi.com keep per-user learning data private, or log aggregated learning patterns (e.g., 'death keywords suppressed humor for 3000 users')?
PORTAL crossing: Does appending to learned_*.jsonl file at session boundary (Portal protocol) work for multi-user solaceagi.com or do we need immediate merging?
LLM validators: Should each validator write its own learned_*.jsonl (phase1_learn.jsonl, learned_wishes.jsonl, learned_combos.jsonl) or share one file?
Confidence threshold: Should CPU use a global confidence threshold (0.80) or phase-specific (small-talk=0.70, intent=0.80, execute=0.90)?
Haiku cost: Should we rate-limit LLM validators to avoid expensive runs? (e.g., only validate 5% of requests, or only when CPU confidence < 0.5)?
Diagram: Should prime-mermaid show Portal crossing (CPU bubble ↔ LLM bubble via learned_*.jsonl)? Would help users understand BIC boundary?
Testing: Should we test the full loop with 50 sessions to verify LEAK (asymmetric learning) actually works? Measure accuracy before/after?
Observability: Should Portal crossing (LLM → learned_*.jsonl → CPU) be logged/monitored? Metrics: overrides_per_session, confidence_distribution, etc?
SW5.0 compliance: Are we correctly implementing LEAK (asymmetric knowledge transfer)? How do we verify that CPU actually absorbs LLM knowledge?
